name: Style Transfer Detection
description: Detects artifacts from neural style transfer operations applied to images.
algorithm: Neural Style Transfer Artifact Detection via Gram Matrix Divergence
mechanism: Neural style transfer creates characteristic artifacts in texture statistics. This method compares local Gram matrix features across patches to detect unnaturally uniform texture statistics.
parameters: Feature layers: VGG conv1-5, Gram matrix: per-patch, Divergence: KL, Patch: 64×64 sliding window
source: Wang, S.Y. et al. (2020) — CNN-Generated Images are Surprisingly Easy to Spot... for Now, CVPR
useCase: Identifying images that have undergone neural style transfer processing

references.title: Wang, S.Y. et al. (2020) — CNN-Generated Images are Surprisingly Easy to Spot... for Now, CVPR

strengths:
• Detects NST-specific artifacts
• Works across different style models
• Gram matrix features are discriminative
• Can detect partial style transfer
limitations:
• May miss subtle style transfers
• Confusion with artistic filters
• Dependent on style transfer method
• Requires reference style knowledge
